comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Hi Brad,

I am aware of the situation. HttpClient 3.1 will be officially declared end of life at the same time with the 4.1 final release. I am going to update the legacy web site shortly after. HttpClient 4.1 final is planned for early Q1 2011.

Oleg

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Old web site moved to http://hc.apache.org/httpclient-legacy/. EOL notice added to features, index, news, overview and userguide pages.

Oleg

description:
If you google for "http client" or "httpclient" or "apache http client" the first result is always legacy Commons-HttpClient page.  If you follow the link, there's no indication whatsoever on the legacy page that its not the latest version, or that it's end-of-lifed.  Unless you're already aware of HttpComponents, there's no obvious way to find it from the legacy page.  The only reference to HttpComponents is actually in the 'History' section.  

The source for the legacy page should be updated to indicate Commons-HttpClient is an end-of-lifed project and should provide a pointer to the new HttpComponents page in a more prominent location.
summary: Update 3.x legacy homepage with end of life notification and pointer to HTTPComponents
